News

"Stop Circuit Laundry" campaign launched on campus

By Gracie Daw

The campaign has over 500 signatures from students and demands that the University of York end their contract with Circuit Laundry

Open Letter sent to the Vice Chancellor arguing against pay cut for marking boycott

By James Clay

York academics and students respond to pay cut for staff participating in marking boycott

Nouse interviews students standing as candidates for the local council

By James Clay

Student council candidates share their thoughts in the run up to the local elections

York set for 2023 local council elections

By James Clay

Lib Dems and Labour battle it out to take overall majority control of the City of York Council.

Labour gain control of the council after winning local elections

By James Clay

A disappointing night for the Lib Dems and Greens in York as Labour reach a majority of council seats

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

University announces death of Long Boi

By Gracie Daw

The University released a statement on the Radio 1 Breakfast show saying they were "forced to conclude he has passed away"

FTR 'racist'

International Students at the University have spoken out against drivers and conductors on FTR buses, stating that they treat foreign students "like second class citizens" (Thumbnail credit Staff of the bus company FTR have been accused of racist behaviour towards foreign students; Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

YUSU outrage as University buy 'immovable' tables for Derwent and ask JCRC to pay costs

There has been outrage amongst YUSU this week following the University's decision to buy heavy tables for the new Derwent bar, and their subsequent suggestion that the college should pay half the charge for the required portering involved to move them for certain events (Thumbnail credit Clubs such as the York Hornets are finding it increasingly difficult to find flat floor space to use on campus; Image: The York Hornets)

Free dyslexia tests to be charged at PS250 next year

From August, dyslexia testing at the University of York will cost PS250 for all students who are subsequently found to be dyslexic (Thumbnail credit Lacy proposed date changes; Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Nouse fifty 2010

By James Bithell

In May, we asked campus to nominate the people it thought were most deserving of recognition this year

Sabbatical Officers' annual evaluation of policy pledges

By James Bithell

Camilla Apcar assesses how far the YUSU Sabbatical Officers have progressed in fulfilling their 2009 election promises

New Goodricke buildings 'unbearable'

Students living in the New Goodricke College accommodation on Heslington East have expressed concern about the quality of the new buildings (Thumbnail credit Cracked walls and hot kitchens have left residents in discomfort; Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

University denies plans to shut McQ's

The University has this week denied rumours that it plans to close the campus bar McQ's over the summer (Thumbnail credit The University has denied plans to close McQ's this summer, despite YUSU expressing concerns earlier this year regarding its closure; Image: Scarborough Design)

Students 'detached from YUSU campaigns' as portering row between leaders continues

Concerns have been raised over what has been perceived as a split in the campaign to restore 24 hour portering on campus (Thumbnail credit Ngwena, Etheridge and Humphrys used to unite for the cause; Photo: George Lowther)

University green rating drops

The University of York has fallen 13 places in People and Planet's Green League for Environmental Performance since last year, moving to 48th place in the national league table (Thumbnail credit York's waste management let it down in the recent green league; Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

University Biology professor awarded OBE

Professor Debbie Smith, of the Department of Biology, has said that she is "surprised and delighted" to have been awarded an OBE this month

Misleading information in prospectus regarding foreign exchange schemes

A number of students have vocalised their frustration that the initial description of the University of York's study worldwide scheme in its 2009/10 and 2010/11 prospectuses misleads prospective students (Thumbnail credit Only one per cent of first-year undergraduates will get the opportunity to go to places such as Columbia; Image: Skreuzer)

Security concerns after staff fail to answer Vanbrugh's emergency red phone

The Security services at the University have been accused of neglecting their welfare duty to students after it was revealed that security staff have failed to answer the emergency red telephone next to the Vanbrugh porters lodge on a number of occasions (Thumbnail credit Emergency red phones are supposed to be answered immediately)

University criticised about cycle lanes

Criticism has been aimed at the University by a local councillor for their inaction in constructing cycle lanes around New Goodricke (Thumbnail credit A councillor has accused the University of not providing an integrated cycle track near campus; Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

International student fees rise by over PS1,000

Concerns have this week been raised over the PS1,000 increase in tuition fees for international students in the next academic year

York Alumni Association launch new online community system

Next term the York Alumni Association (YAA) will launch a unique password protected online community, YorkSpace.net (Thumbnail credit YAA are confident that YorkSpace.net will improve networking; Photo: Justyn Hardcastle)

Review of the year 2009/2010

By James Bithell

Hannah Ellis-Petersen and Laura Connor survey the biggest news on campus this year

World renowned art historians join York

Two of the world's most distinguished art historians, T.J. Clark and Anne Wagner, are to join the University of York's History of Art department in October this year

Campus-wide audit to be conducted

A campus-wide accommodation audit is to be conducted after a recent survey in Langwith found a high proportion of rooms had faults

GSA to rebrand in same vein as YUSU

The Graduate Student Association (GSA) have announced plans to have their organisation re-branded with the help of an outside marketing agency in an attempt to respond to a lack of awareness of the GSA on campus

Pantomime forced to switch venue

The final night of the summer pantomime will now take place on Vanbrugh Paradise after a noise complaint forced the performance to relocate from its original location, the Charles XII pub in Heslington (Thumbnail credit Photo: George Lowther)

YUSU Awards 2010

<em>Nouse</em> live blog coverage of the University of York's first YUSU Awards ceremony

Minister's comments cause outrage among students

Both students across campus and YUSU officers have expressed their anger at comments made by universities minister David Willetts stating that students are a "burden on the taxpayer" (Thumbnail credit David Willetts MP; Photo: Edge Foundation via Creative Commons)

University of York moves into Guardian University League top 10

The University of York has moved up two places, from eleventh place last year to ninth place this year, in the Guardian newspaper's University League Table

Hockey Club fined following initiation video

The University of York Hockey Club (UYHC) has been fined PS200 by the York Sport Committee, following a complaint regarding an initiation video filmed last weekend

Top 50 short-list announced

Nominations for the <em>Nouse</em> Top 50 closed at 12 midday today

University of York ranked ninth in The Times Good University Guide

It has been revealed today that the University of York has been ranked ninth in The Times Good University Guide, up two places from last year

Female academics marginalised

An investigation by <em>Nouse</em> has uncovered statistics showing a pay gap of over PS2,718 between male and female Professors at the University, as well as a dominance of males in senior academic positions (Thumbnail credit Philosophy was one of the worst departments in the University, with females making up only 13 per cent of the total academic staff, Image: University Of York website)

Proposal to rebuild York City Stadium by Heslington East divides opinion

A proposal to rebuild York City Community Stadium adjacent to the Heslington East campus has been met with resistance from figures both within and outside of YUSU (Thumbnail credit It has been proposed that York City Stadium is built by Hes. East, Photo: Peter Iveson)

Data reveals disparity between the number of 'good degrees' awarded in subject departments

Concern has been raised by academics and University officials after data surveying degree classification in 2008/9 showed inconsistency between some academic departments (Thumbnail credit Data for degrees from the academic year 2008/9 has shown vast inconsistency across departments, Photo: Lily Eastwood)

On-campus security alert prompts police investigation

A Police investigation has begun this week following flyers requesting female students to pose for photographs whilst urinating on themselves being posted in Langwith and the woodland area near Windmill Lane (Thumbnail credit The flyers were posted in Langwith and near Windmill Lane, Photo: Sam Newsome)
